body.p: To set the Global options of , go to Options Preferences Global .
The following options are available in the Global preferences page:

ul.li: Automatic Version Checking - Sets whether will check for a new version on startup.
Language - Sets the language used in the user interface to English, French, German, Dutch, Japanese, or Italian. You must restart for the change to take effect.

Other language - Sets the language used in the user interface to another language using an interface localization file (either properties or XML). For details about creating this file, see . If some interface labels are not rendered correctly after restarting the application, (for example Chinese or Korean characters are not displayed correctly), make sure that your operating system had the appropriate language pack installed (for example the East-Asian language pack).
Look and Feel - Allows you to change graphic style (look and feel) of the user interface.

Styles - Allows you to set the style of the interface. On Windows there are available the following styles:
Office 2003
Vsnet
Eclipse
Xerto
Default After changing the style, restart the application in order for the modification to take effect.
On Linux there are available the following styles:
Eclipse
Default After changing the style, you have to restart the application in order for the modification to take effect.
On Mac OS X this option is not available.

Themes - Allows you to set the theme of the interfaced. On Windows this option is enabled only if you have selected theOffice 2003 or Default styles. The following themes are available:
Normal Color
Home Stead
Metallic
Default
Gray
On Linux and Mac OS X this option is not available.

Line separator - Allows you to specify the line separator use when saving files. Use System Default to select the normal line separator for your OS. If you want the existing file separator of a file to be maintained, regardless of your current OS, check Detect the line separator on file open.

Detect the line separator on file open - When this option is checked, the editor detects the line separator when a file is loaded and it uses it when the file is saved. New files are saved using the line separator defined by theLine separator option.
Open last edited files from project - When enabled, opens the files you had open the last time you used a project whenever you open the application or switch to that project.

Beep on operation finished - When selected, beeps when a validation or transform action ends. Different tones are used for success and failure. The tones used may depend on your operating system's sound settings.

Show memory status - When selected, the memory uses is displayed in the status bar. To free memory, click the Run Garbage Collector button located at the right side of the status bar. The memory status bar turns yellow or red when uses too much memory. You can change the amount of memory available to Oxygen by changing the parameters of the application launcher.

Check opened files for file system changes - If selected, checks the content of the all opened editors to see if they have been updated by another application. If the file has changed, it will ask you if you want to reload the file.
Auto update unmodified editors on file system changes - If selected, automatically updates unmodified editors if the edited file changes externally. By default this option is disabled, meaning that you are prompted to decide if you want to update the file content. Check opened files for file system changes and Auto update unmodified editors on file system changes influence only DITA documents.
Show Java vendor warning at startup - If selected, displays a warning on startup if a non-recommended version of the Java virtual machine is being used.

li.p: File Chooser Dialog - Set the directory that will be shown when the Open file dialog is displayed.

ul.li: Last visited directory - The last visited folder.
Directory of the edited file - The folder where the currently edited file is stored.
Show hidden files and directories - Shows system hidden files and folders in the file browser dialog and the folder browser dialog. This setting is not available on OS X.
